title: Coronation Street spoilers: Wedding blues, Huge feud and more
text:
Tensions are high and there’s relationship issues aplenty in another big week for Coronation Street, as Abi Franklin (Sally Carman) fights with Sally Metcalfe (Sally Dynevor) over Kevin Webster (Michael Le Well), and Gary Windass (Mikey North) isn’t too pleased to learn that Ali Neeson (James Burrows) has been spending time with Maria Connor (Samia Longchambon).

Elsewhere, there’s more worries for Shona Ramsey (Julia Goulding) as she panics about whether or not David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) will be released from prison in time for their wedding, as Nick (Ben Price) attempts to come up with a plan to get Josh Tucker (Ryan Clayton) to change his statement about David’s involvement in his stabbing.

10 Corrie spoilers Nick tries to get Josh to change his mind

Shona’s devastated when Gail cancels her wedding

Gary puts a private detective on Ali

Abi goes out with Kevin the night before her maths GCSE exam

Ken tries to get in touch with Daniel

New evidence comes to light which could mean David’s in the clear

Amy reveals to Emma that she’s been texting Tyler

The wedding guests gather, but David’s nowhere to be seen

Geoff continues to knock Yasmeen’s confidence

Roy becomes addicted to online scrabble

Monday 4th November Part One

Advertisement

Advertisement

Steve reports Ali’s negligence to Dr Gaddas, as Emma recovers in the hospital. Ali is left devastated, and thus meets with Maria, revealing to her that he shouldn’t have dumped her, before admitting that he’s jealous of Gary. The pair embrace, as Adam watches on — and he later relays this information to an angry Gary.

With David still stuck in prison, Gail deicides to cancel the wedding, which leaves Shona devastated. In spite of the circumstances, she’s convinced David will be out in time for the ceremony.

A delivery of beard oil addressed to Sinead arrives, and Carla decides to try and keep the business alive for Daniel’s sake. Abi plans a date with Kevin the night before her GCSE maths exam — much to Brian’s dismay — and Nick comes up with a plan to get Josh to change his mind.

Monday 4th November Part Two

Nick attempts to visit Josh in prison — hoping to masquerade as his solicitor — but Billy finds out what he’s up to and ultimately puts a stop to it. However, Leanne believes that Billy could prove to be the solution they’re in need of, as he could possibly speak to Josh on their behalf.

After learning of Maria and Ali’s rendezvous, Gary puts a plan in motion as he meets up with his private detective and asks him to get him some info on Ali.

Sally’s not in the least bit pleased when she discovers that Abi’s not revising for her exam, but rather she’s drunk with Kevin.

Advertisement

Wednesday 6th November Part One

Billy heads to the hospital to speak to Josh, but — upon doing so — Josh reveals that he’s only interested in looking after number one. Paul stumbles upon an upset Billy, and — after the pair have a conversation — Billy reveals that Josh raped David.

Carla informs Ken that she’s got a meeting with a company interested in purchasing Sinead’s beard oil. However, the problem is is that she needs to speak to Daniel. Ken makes an attempt to contact his son in Scotland.

Meanwhile, Gary discovers that it was Dr Gaddas who reported Ali —and thus he decides to get his PI on the case in the hope of uncovering some more secrets —, while Emma agrees to stay with Steve after she’s released from hospital.

Wednesday 6th November Part Two

As Shona prepares to put away all her wedding gear, she’s shocked to hear that some new evidence has come to light — which could mean that David might be released.

With the animosity having reached new levels, Sally accuses Abi of being only interested in Kevin for the cash that he’s recently come into, and a fuming Abi retaliates by throwing a bowl of spaghetti bolognese over Sally.

Elsewhere, Ken and Claudia decide to head off to Scotland and bring Daniel back themselves, and Gary discovers that one of the hospital pharmacists was arrested for stealing and supplying drugs.

Thursday 7th November

The day of the wedding arrives, and Shona couldn’t be more excited as she tells Audrey and Gail that David will soon be released — thus confirming that she’s going ahead with the ceremony. However, Audrey and Gail aren’t so sure. As the wedding guests arrive, will David show up?

Advertisement

Gary intimidates the hospital drug dealer into giving him information on Ali, and Sally and Abi make amends.

Friday 8th November Part One

Robert discovers Tyler’s back on the Street and he’s devastated —fearing that he’ll discover the truth about his double life. Therefore, he informs Steve of Tyler and Amy being mates once more, hoping that this will drive the young lad away from the cobbles.

After doing some snooping of his own, Ali discovers Gary’s ledger, and threatens to inform Maria of the builder operating as a loan shark.

Michelle tells Ray to stick his job, Geoff makes sure that Yasmeen sees him on a dating site, and Carla grows concerned when she discovers that Roy has an online Scrabble addiction.

Friday 8th November Part Two

Robert’s actions leaver Carla confused as to why he felt compelled to inform Steve about Amy’s friendship with Tyler, and Michelle is equally left baffled.

Geoff continues to knock Yasmeen’s confidence, as he tells her that she has an awful memory. Carla meddles in Roy’s affairs and sets up an actual game of scrabble with Mary, Brian and Evelyn. However, once he discovers what she’s done, he’s incredibly upset and storms out as a result.
